unit.name: dimensionless
unit.description: a designation asserting the absence of an associated unit

unit.name: candela
unit.description: SI base unit of luminous intensity (luminous power per unti solid angle emitted by a point light source in a particular direction)

unit.name: nominalMinute
unit.description: one minute of time excluding leap seconds, 60 seconds

unit.name: nominalHour
unit.description: one hour excluding leap seconds, 3600 seconds

unit.name: nominalDay
unit.description: one day excluding leap seconds, 86400 seconds

unit.name: nominalWeek
unit.description: one day excluding leap seconds, 604800 seconds

unit.name: nominalYear
unit.description: one year excluding leap seconds and leap days, 31536000 seconds

unit.name: nominalLeapYear
unit.description: one 366 day year excluding leap seconds, 31622400 seconds

unit.name: tonne
unit.description: unit of mass equal to 1,000 kilograms, equivalent to approximately 2,204.6 pounds,1.102 short tons (US) or 0.984 long tons (imperial). Not part of the SI, but accepted for use with SI units and prefixes

unit.name: pound
unit.description: 1 pound (symbol lb) in the Avoirdupois (commerce) scale, and defined as exactly 0.45359237 kg. Also equal to 16 avoirdupois ounces and to 7,000 grains.

unit.name: fahrenheit
unit.description: unit for temperature on the scale in which water freezes at 32 and boils at 212 under standard conditions.

unit.name: inch
unit.description: unit of length in the (British) imperial and United States systems usually understood as 1/12 f a foot.

unit.name: nauticalMile
unit.description: defined as exactly 1,852 meters (6,076.1 ft; 1.1508 mi). Historically, defined as one minute of latitude.

unit.name: Yard_Indian
unit.description: This is an ESRI unit and the multiplier comes from ESRI. It may not be accurate.

unit.name: Link_Clarke
unit.description: This is an ESRI unit and the multiplier comes from ESRI. It may not be accurate.

unit.name: Yard_Sears
unit.description: This is an ESRI unit and the multiplier comes from ESRI. It may not be accurate.

unit.name: inchCubed
unit.description: micromoles per square meter per second

unit.name: radian
unit.description: 2 pi radians comprise a unit circle.

unit.name: grad
unit.description: a plane angle equivalent to 1/400 of a full circle

unit.name: steradian
unit.description: standard unit of solid angle measure, it is the solid angle which cuts out an area on a sphere that is the square of the sphere's radius; as a ratio of two areas, it has no dimension

unit.name: hertz
unit.description: derived unit of frequency in the SI, defined as one cycle per second

unit.name: calorie
unit.description: unit of energy: amount of energy to raise the temperature of one gram of water by one degree Celsius at a pressure of one atmosphere. cal = 4.1868 J

unit.name: langley
unit.description: unit of energy density = 41840 joule/m^2, = 1 calorie/cm^2

unit.name: lumen
unit.description: SI unit for the total quantity of visible light in a defined beam or angle. 1 lumen/m^2 = 1 lux. 1 lumen = 1 candela * steradian

unit.name: lux
unit.description: SI derived unit for illuminance, or luminous flux per unit area. 1 lx = 1 lm/m^2 = 1 cd * sr/m^2

unit.name: becquerel
unit.description: SI derived unit of radioactivity. the activity of a quantity of radioactive material in which one nucleus decays per second, and equivalent to an inverse second, s^-1.

unit.name: gray
unit.description: SI derived unit of ionizing radiation, defined as the absorption of one joule of radiation energy per kilogram of matter (= 1 J/kg)

unit.name: sievert
unit.description: SI derived unit of ionizing radiation dose (health effect of low levels of ionizing radiation on humans). 1 Sv = 100 rem (rem is an older, non-SI unit)

unit.name: katal
unit.description: derived SI unit for quantifying enzymatic activity.A property of the catalyst (not rate of reaction), expressed in moles/second.

unit.name: henry
unit.description: SI derived unit for inductance; in SI base units: kg * m^2 * s^-2 * A^-2

unit.name: megawatt
unit.description: unit of power, to quantify rate of energy transfer. 1 W = J/s

unit.name: kilowatt
unit.description: unit of power, to quantify rate of energy transfer. 1 W = J/s

unit.name: watt
unit.description: unit of power, to quantify rate of energy transfer. 1 W = J/s

unit.name: milliwatt
unit.description: unit of power, to quantify rate of energy transfer. 1 W = J/s

unit.name: megavolt
unit.description: Derived unit for electric potential, electric potential difference, and electromotive force. 1 V = kg * m^2 * s^-3 * A^-1

unit.name: kilovolt
unit.description: Derived unit for electric potential, electric potential difference, and electromotive force. 1 V = kg * m^2 * s^-3 * A^-1

unit.name: volt
unit.description: Derived unit for electric potential, electric potential difference, and electromotive force. 1 V = kg * m^2 * s^-3 * A^-1

unit.name: millivolt
unit.description: Derived unit for electric potential, electric potential difference, and electromotive force. 1 V = kg * m^2 * s^-3 * A^-1

unit.name: farad
unit.description: SI derived unit of electrical capacitance, the ability of a body to store an electrical charge. 1 F = s^4 * A^2 *m^-2 * kg^-1

unit.name: ohm
unit.description: an electrical resistance between two points of a conductor when a constant potential difference of one volt, applied to these points, produces in the conductor a current of one ampere

unit.name: ohmMeter
unit.description: SI unit of electrical resistivity (fundamental property that quantifies how strongly a material opposes the flow of electric current). reciprocal of electrical conductivity.

unit.name: siemensPerMeter
unit.description: SI unit for conductivity, measure of a material's ability to conduct an electric current.

unit.name: siemensPerCentimeter
unit.description: SI unit for conductivity, measure of a material's ability to conduct an electric current.

unit.name: siemens
unit.description: SI derived unit of electric conductance, susceptance and admittance (reciprocals of resistance, reactance, and impedance respectively). One siemens is equal to the reciprocal of one ohm (and also called "mho")

unit.name: weber
unit.description: the SI unit of magnetic flux

unit.name: tesla
unit.description: unit for flux density. 1 tesla = 1 Wb/m^2 (one weber per square meter).

unit.name: pascal
unit.description: SI derived unit of pressure, 1 pascal = 1 newton/m^2

unit.name: megapascal
unit.description: SI derived unit of pressure, 1 pascal = 1 newton/m^2

unit.name: kilopascal
unit.description: SI derived unit of pressure, 1 pascal = 1 newton/m^2

unit.name: hectopascal
unit.description: SI derived unit of pressure, 1 pascal = 1 newton/m^2

unit.name: atmosphere
unit.description: unit of pressure defined as 101325 Pa (1.01325 bar), sometimes used as a reference or standard pressure

unit.name: bar
unit.description: non-SI unit for pressure (deprecated in some fields). 1 bar = 100000 Pa

unit.name: millibar
unit.description: non-SI unit for pressure (deprecated in some fields). 1 millibar = 1 hPa (100 Pa)

unit.name: decibar
unit.description: non-SI unit for pressure. 1 decibar = .1 bar. Decibars are commonly used in aquatic environments because 1 db is approximately equal to depth in meters.

unit.name: tonnePerHectare
unit.description: metric ton or tonne per hectare

unit.name: milligramPerMilliliter
unit.description: micromoles per square meter per second

unit.name: milligramPerMeterCubedPerDay
unit.description: milligram per cubic meter per day

unit.name: acre
unit.description: 1 acre = 4046.8564 square meters or 1 hectare = 2.4710 acres

unit.name: bushelsPerAcre
unit.description: bushels per acre, 1 bushel = 35.23907 liters/1 acre = 4046.8564 squareMeters

unit.name: bushelPerAcre
unit.description: bushels per acre, 1 bushel = 35.23907 liters/1 acre = 4046.8564 squareMeters

unit.name: knot
unit.description: unit of speed equal to one nautical mile per hour, exactly 1.852 km/hour

unit.name: meterPerSecondSquared
unit.description: micromoles per square meter per second

unit.name: amperePerSquareMeter
unit.description: ampere per meter squared, unit of current density

unit.name: amperePerMeterSquared
unit.description: amperes per square meter, unit of current density

unit.name: molePerLiter
unit.description: moles per liter (perferred over molarity, as molarity refers only to dissolved substances)

unit.name: microequivalentPerLiter
unit.description: concentration of charge (on dissolved ions). conversions must know the name of the ion; a single multiplier to SI is not possible

unit.name: milliequivalentPerLiter
unit.description: concentration of charge (on dissolved ions). conversions must know the name of the ion; a single multiplier to SI is not possible

unit.name: equivalentPerLiter
unit.description: concentration of charge (on dissolved ions). conversions must know the name of the ion; a single multiplier to SI is not possible

unit.name: metersSquaredPerSecond
unit.description: meters squared per second, SI unit for kinematic viscosity, specific relative angular momentum and thermal diffusivity. The unit may be better understood when phrased as "meter per second times meter" (velocity of an object with respect to a position).

unit.name: meterSquaredPerSecond
unit.description: meters squared per second, SI unit for kinematic viscosity, specific relative angular momentum and thermal diffusivity. The unit may be better understood when phrased as "meter per second times meter" (velocity of an object with respect to a position).

unit.name: kilogramsPerMeterSquaredPerSecond
unit.description: kilograms per meter sqared per second

unit.name: gramsPerCentimeterSquaredPerSecond
unit.description: grams Per Centimeter Squared Per Second

unit.name: gramsPerMeterSquaredPerYear
unit.description: grams Per Meter Squared Per Year

unit.name: kilogramsPerMeterSquaredPerYear
unit.description: kilograms Per Meter Squared Per Year

unit.name: gramPerCentimeterSquaredPerSecond
unit.description: grams per square centimeter per second

unit.name: gramPerDayPerHectare
unit.description: grams Per Hectare Squared Per Day

unit.name: gramPerMeterSquaredPerYear
unit.description: grams per square meter per year

unit.name: kilogramPerMeterSquaredPerSecond
unit.description: kilograms per square meter per second

unit.name: kilogramPerMeterSquaredPerDay
unit.description: kilograms per square meter per day

unit.name: gramPerMeterSquaredPerDay
unit.description: grams per square meter per day

unit.name: milligramPerMeterSquaredPerDay
unit.description: milligram per square meter per day

unit.name: kilogramPerMeterSquaredPerYear
unit.description: kilograms per square meter per year

unit.name: numberPerMeterSquared
unit.description: number per meter squared, e.g., for a population density.

unit.name: percent
unit.description: percent, one part per hundred parts. a decimal ratio multipled by 100

unit.name: permil
unit.description: permil, one part per thousand parts. a decimal ratio multipled by 1000

unit.name: wattPerMeterSquared
unit.description: watts per square meter, also, 1 kilogram per second cubed (ie, a flux)

unit.name: wattPerMeterSquaredPerSteradian
unit.description: watts per square meter, in a solid angle

unit.name: microwattPerCentimeterSquaredPerSteradian
unit.description: watts per square centimeter, in a solid angle

unit.name: wattPerMeterSquaredPerNanometer
unit.description: watts per square meter, per unit of wavelength

unit.name: microwattPerCentimeterSquaredPerNanometer
unit.description: watts per square centimeter, per unit of wavelength

unit.name: wattPerMeterSquaredPerNanometerPerSteradian
unit.description: watts per square meter, per unit of wavelength in a solid angle

unit.name: microwattPerCentimeterSquaredPerNanometerPerSteradian
unit.description: microwatts per square centimeter, per unit of wavelength, in a solid angle

unit.name: molePerMeterSquaredPerSecond
unit.description: micromoles per square meter per second

unit.name: micromolePerMeterSquaredPerSecond
unit.description: micromoles per square meter per second

unit.name: micromolePerCentimeterSquaredPerSecond
unit.description: micromoles per square centimeter per second

unit.name: megajoulePerMeterSquaredPerDay
unit.description: megajoules per square meter per day

unit.name: langleyPerDay
unit.description: Langley (Ly) per day. Ly is a unit of energy density = 41840 joule/m^2, = 1 calorie/cm^2
